question.title: All my java applications now throw a java.awt.headlessexception

node.contents: A small example that throws this exception would help a lot.

astNode.text: A small example that throws this exception would help a lot.

node.contents: This exception is thrown when code that is dependent on a keyboard, display, or mouse is called in an environment that does not support a keyboard, display, or mouse. How you're executing your app?

astNode.text: This exception is thrown when code that is dependent on a keyboard, display, or mouse is called in an environment that does not support a keyboard, display, or mouse. How you're executing your app?

node.contents: I'll see if I can write something small really quick that does it. All the examples are large parts of code. I'm executing it on my laptop as a Java Application. It used to work.

astNode.text: I'll see if I can write something small really quick that does it. All the examples are large parts of code. I'm executing it on my laptop as a Java Application. It used to work.

node.contents: What OS? Are you executing from the command line or from within the context of a graphical environment?

astNode.text: What OS? Are you executing from the command line or from within the context of a graphical environment?

node.contents: I'm using Linux Mint 16 and Eclipse for Java Dev.

astNode.text: I'm using Linux Mint 16 and Eclipse for Java Dev.

node.contents: Is it possible that you have a headless JRE installed? (Check your Java installation, if in doubt, try reinstalling.)

astNode.text: Is it possible that you have a headless JRE installed? (Check your Java installation, if in doubt, try reinstalling.)

node.contents: @MadProgrammer Thank you for your insight, I tried running it from the command line and found that the _javac_ command was not even recognized haha. IDK how that happened but I reinstalled openJDK and it all works now.

astNode.text: @MadProgrammer Thank you for your insight, I tried running it from the command line and found that the _javac_ command was not even recognized haha. IDK how that happened but I reinstalled openJDK and it all works now.

node.contents: So a couple days ago I had several working Java applications using the Swing library, JFrame in particular. They all worked perfectly fine and now they all throw this exception:

astNode.text: So a couple days ago I had several working Java applications using the Swing library, JFrame in particular. They all worked perfectly fine and now they all throw this exception:

node.contents: I don't know what changed maybe my Java version got updated by accident.

astNode.text: I don't know what changed maybe my Java version got updated by accident.

node.contents: Thanks for any help you can offer.

astNode.text: Thanks for any help you can offer.

node.contents: Here's a small piece of code that gives me the exception.

astNode.text: Here's a small piece of code that gives me the exception.

elements.contents: import javax.swing.JFrame; public class test { public static JFrame frame; public static void main(String[] args) { frame = new JFrame("test"); frame.setVisible(true); frame.setLocationRelativeTo(null); } }

units.rawText: import javax.swing.JFrame; public class test { public static JFrame frame; public static void main(String[] args) { frame = new JFrame("test"); frame.setVisible(true); frame.setLocationRelativeTo(null); } }

node.contents:
HeadlessException

Thrown when code that is dependent on a keyboard, display, or mouse is called in an environment that does not support a keyboard, display, or mouse.
